Create a Record for Stationary Asset Carbon Footprint

Create carbon footprint records related to the emissions based on the energy use records.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions


PERMISSION SET
NEEDED
To enter and modify data:	

Net Zero Cloud Manager

OR

Net Zero Cloud Admin

OR

Net Zero Cloud Light

NOTE This record is a container for individual footprint item records, which contain the carbon footprints for individual fuel types. See Calculate Stationary Asset Carbon Footprint Items
From Stationary Asset Carbon Footprints, click New.
Enter a record name.
Enter the stationary asset environmental source.
When consolidating emissions, the carbon footprint is associated with the account name selected on the stationary asset environmental source.
If you’re accounting for multiple companies in a single Salesforce org, to consolidate emissions across all companies in your organizational structure, select the annual emissions inventory of the parent company.
To indicate the workflow status of the record, select a footprint stage.
Enter the previous year’s annual carbon footprint value.
Select the allocation status of renewable energy for the record.
To override the occupied floor area of the related stationary asset, enter an occupied floor area value.
To override the total floor area of the related stationary asset, enter a total floor area value.
To adjust emissions inputs for factors that aren’t indicated on the record types, enter values for these fields:
Supplemental Scope 1 Emissions
Supplemental Scope 2 Location-Based Emissions
Supplemental Scope 2 Market-Based Emissions
Supplemental Scope 3 Upstream Emissions
Supplemental Scope 3 Downstream Emissions
Enter information for any optional fields.
Save your changes.
To view the related energy use records, click Related.
To add new energy use records for this asset category, in the Energy Uses section, click New.

The Details page is updated with the total energy use summary information.
